title: Château d'Aurilhac 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: This rich wine is juicy with black-currant fruit and crisp with acidity. The wood aging is just on the right side of too much, but shows in the wine's spicy, dry character. The fresh fruit should come through strongly as the wine matures. Drink from 2023.

title: Château de Bensse 2015  Médoc
description: While the estate remains family owned, the production is run by the local cooperative. This wine is richly textured, dense with tannins and acidity. Black-currant fruits and a dry core promise aging potential. It will be ready from 2022.

title: Château la Rose de Vitrac 2016  Bordeaux Blanc
description: This wine comes from a sector of the Entre-deux-Mers that is particularly suited to white wines. It shows in this ripe, lightly mineral-textured wine with apple, citrus and touches of spice. Drink this attractive wine from mid-2018.

title: Château Lacour Jacquet 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: Produced by the third generation of the Lartigue family to own this estate, this wine is firm and conveys a strong sense of wood aging over the black-currant fruits. Produced from almost equal proportions of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, it is still very young and needs time to release its full potential. Drink from 2024.

title: Domaine Virginie Thunevin 2015  Bordeaux
description: From vines close to Fronsac, this wine comes from Thunevin family vines. It is soft, with attractive black-currant fruit and spicy wood and tannins. It will be ready to drink from mid-2018.

title: Duck Pond 2016 St. Jory Vineyard Skin Contact Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: This unusual wine is a bright strawberry shade and offers intense aromatics and flavors of strawberries and ripe cherries. It was fermented on the skins for 14 days, and one-quarter of the total was whole cluster. This is a tasty wine with some citrus snap to the finish.

title: Fatty Pope 2015 Red (Paso Robles)
description: Dark strawberry, black plum, fennel pollen, tarragon and a hint of caramel show on the nose of the solid second vintage for this memorably labeled bottle. Ripe purple fruit meets with minty spices on the palate, where the richness is cut by directed acidity.

title: Fowles Wine 2016 Are You Game? Chardonnay (Victoria)
description: While the nose is ripe and borderline over-the-top in aromas of candied melon, tropical fruit and butter, the palate is unexpectedly fresher, with bright acidity ensconced in a cloak of grainy, textural weight and oak flavors throughout.

title: French Bar 2015 Petite Sirah (California)
description: This is a very good, moderate rendering of the varietal, blending good blackberry aromas with lightly smoky peppery flavors and medium to full body. It's firmly tannic and will taste great with juicy meats and indulgent cheesy pastas.

title: It Is What It Is! NV Red (Lodi)
description: This is a pretty concentrated fruit-driven wine that shows focused red and black-cherry flavors and an elegant texture. It sips very smoothly, feels light to medium bodied and has a fresh fruity finish.

title: Jerusalem Wineries 2016 2900 Merlot (Judean Hills)
description: Deep red-violet to the eye, this wine has aromas of dark plum, cherry and juniper. It might be a little too restrained for some, with flavors of black cherry and Red Delicious apple, joined by strong notes of eucalyptus, spearmint and anise. Smooth tannins fill the palate right into a cool mint finish.

title: José Maria da Fonseca 2016 JMF Red (Península de Setúbal)
description: This is a generous wine, ripe with blackberry fruits. A blend of Castelão and Aragonez grapes, it has a rich texture, the tannins softly integrated into the full fruitiness. Juicy acidity completes a well-structured wine. Drink from late 2018.

title: Juwel 2016 Grauburgunder (Rheinhessen)
description: Invigorating freshness abounds in this dry, medium-bodied Grauburgunder, or Pinot Gris. Pristine lemon, apple and pear flavors are cutting and bright, marked by fresh acidity and a delicately textured mouthfeel. It's an easy going quaffer to enjoy now.

title: Kuentz-Bas 2015 Muscat (Alsace)
description: A touch of bruised apple peel fills the nose. The very light palate counters this with bright notions of fresh lemon on a dry, slender palate. This is clean-cut and refreshing, with a lovely lemon finish.

title: Kuentz-Bas 2016 Trois Châteaux Sylvaner (Alsace)
description: A fresh, clean nose of peeled Conference pear leads onto a palate where a yeasty, rounded tone joins this fruity notion. The palate is light and has the merest hint of savoriness, akin to soy. The finish is yeasty, fresh and dry.

title: La Montina 2010 Extra Brut Rosé  (Franciacorta)
description: Aromas of ripe red berry and dried Alpine herb follow through to the racy, rather slender palate together with a note of tangy nectarine zest. Vibrant acidity and a lively perlage give it an invigorating finish.

title: Lucashof 2016 Riesling (Pfalz)
description: Pristine tones of peach, melon and grapefruit are tinged by earth and crushed stone in this light-bodied dry Riesling. Silken on the palate but boasting cutting lemon-lime acidity, it finishes moderately long and citrusy.

title: Marcel Hugg 2016 Réserve Sylvaner (Alsace)
description: Appetizing, fruity notes of pear drop dominate the nose. The palate shows fresh notes of green and yellow pear on a lemony, fresh body. The finish is dry and superclean. Drink soon.

title: Marchesi de' Frescobaldi 2015 Terre More Ammiraglia  (Maremma Toscana)
description: This easygoing blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Syrah offers aromas of black-skinned berry and cooking spice. The savory palate evokes black currant, clove and white pepper alongside polished tannins.

title: Martin Schaetzel 2016 Trio White (Alsace)
description: A luscious bouquet of rose petal and ripe peach on the nose is very convincing and not overblown. The fluid palate shows and edge of pleasant bitterness, countered by an off-dry finish. A lovely aperitif style. Drink soon.

title: Meyer-Fonné 2016 Réserve Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: Red cherry notes on the nose hint at ripeness. The palate presents this ripe fruit with simplicity and freshness. There could be more focus but this is juicy and easy.

title: Monte Rossa NV Brut Nature  (Franciacorta)
description: Made almost entirely with Chardonnay, this opens with aromas of chamomile, yellow stone fruit and a whiff of alpine herb. The lively palate mirrors the nose, offering yellow Bartlett pear, Golden Delicious apple and a hint of pastry dough. A vibrant perlage provide the sparkle.

title: Monte Rossa NV P.R. Brut Blanc de Blanc  (Franciacorta)
description: Aromas suggesting toast, bread crust and whiff of nut meld together. The aromas carry on to the soft palate together with ripe yellow apple and a hint of citrus alongside a light mousse. Bitter walnut is there at the end.

title: Mt. Konocti Winery 2016 Barrel Select Chardonnay (Lake County)
description: This dramatic, hefty wine has strong oaky, spicy aromas, a rich and honeyed fruit flavor and a texture that's almost thick, making it cling to the sides of the mouth. A touch of sweetness registers on the finish.

title: Nera 2012 Sassella Alisio  (Valtellina Superiore)
description: Raspberry, violet and new leather aromas lead the nose. The lithe, rather light-bodied palate offers sour cherry, strawberry and a hint of white pepper. It's easygoing, with supple tannins and firm acidity. Enjoy soon.

title: Nino Negri 2014  Valtellina Superiore
description: The delicate nose suggests wild berry and a whiff of culinary spice that carry over to the fresh easygoing palate along with crushed strawberry and white pepper. It's already approachable, with bright acidity and lithe tannins. Drink soon.

title: Origin 2016 Z'ivo Vineyard Gouges Pinot Blanc (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: Sharp, racy and precise, this particular clone of Pinot Blanc is a rarity anywhere, especially in Oregon. Brisk apple and white-peach fruit comes with a scent of lemon verbena. The finishing tannins have a grainy expression. This would tuck in well with foods usually accompanied by a Loire Valley dry white wine.

title: Pali 2016 Bluffs Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This youthful wine pulls from several vineyards across the appellation, offering strong floral aromas of rose, geranium and lavender. Sizable tannins add to a feeling of full-bodied richness, highlighted in black tea, forest and clove.

title: Peltier 2015 Triomphe Estate Grown Red (Lodi)
description: Aromas of cocoa and maple syrup lead to lush, lightly sweet fruit flavors that have plenty of oak spice to dress them up. This wine tastes very ripe and full bodied, oozing with jammy flavors but it also has enough of a tannic backbone to keep it fresh on the palate.

title: Peter Mertes 2016 Platinum Riesling (Rheinhessen)
description: Crisp tangerine, yellow apple and grapefruit abound in this juicy, delicately sweet Riesling. Easy going yet elegantly balanced, it's a dependable everyday wine with wide appeal.
